sen.j: 千本通（せんぼんどおり）は京都市の主要な南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Sembon-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets of Kyoto City.
Sembon-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets of Kyoto City.
Senbon-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 平安京の朱雀大路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Suzakuoji broad avenue of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Suzakuoji broad avenue of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the broad Suzakuoji avenue of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 現状
sen.e: Today

sen.j: 北は北区 (京都市)鷹峯から南は伏見区納所町の京都府道・大阪府道13号京都守口線交差点まで延びている。
sen.e: It extends from Takagamine in Kita Ward to Kyoto Moriguchi-sen crossing with Kyoto/Osaka Fudo (Kyoto/Osaka Prefectural Road) in Nosocho, Fushimi Ward.
It extends from Takagamine in Kita ward to Kyoto Moriguchi-sen crossing with Kyoto/Osaka Fudo (Kyoto/Osaka Prefectural Road) in Nosocho, Fushimi ward.
It extends from Takagamine in Kita Ward (Kyoto City) in the north to the crossing with Kyoto-Moriguchi Line of the Kyoto/Osaka Prefectural Route 13 in Noso-cho, Fushimi Ward, in the south.
sen.cmt: in the south, in the north Kyoto City 追加 京都府道・大阪府道13号京都守口線交差点を the crossing with Kyoto-Moriguchi Line of the Kyoto/Osaka Prefectural Route 13 としました。

sen.j: 七条通から八条通まで梅小路公園、梅小路蒸気機関車館などで中断。
sen.e: Umekoji Park and Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum interrupts the street between the Shichijo-dori Street and the Hachijo-dori Street.
Umekoji Park and the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum interrupt the street between Shichijo-dori Street and Hachijo-dori Street.
Umekoji Park and the Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum interrupt the street between Shichijo-dori Street and Hachijo-dori Street.

sen.j: また、一筋西に新千本通があるため、八条通から久世橋通間は旧千本通と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The section from the Hachijo-dori Street to the Kuzebashi-dori Street is called former Sembon-dori Street because the Shinsembon-dori Street runs one block west of it.
The section from Hachijo-dori Street to Kuzebashi-dori Street is referred to as the former Sembon-dori Street because Shinsembon-dori Street runs one block west of it.
The section from Hachijo-dori Street to Kuzebashi-dori Street is referred to as the former Senbon-dori Street because Shin-senbon-dori (new Senbon-dori) Street runs one block west of it.

sen.j: 九条通以南は、かつての鳥羽街道である。
sen.e: The section from the Kujo-dori Street was once called Toba-kaido Road.
The section from Kujo-dori Street was once called Toba-kaido Road.
The section south of Kujo-dori Street was once called Toba-kaido Road.

sen.j: 三条通以北は明治から大正にかけて拡幅されているが、三条以南は南北の主要な通りとしての機能は、京都市電の経路そのままに後院通を経て四条通以南で大宮通へとつながる。
sen.e: The section north of the Sanjo-dori Street, was widened in the Meiji era and Taisho era, serving as the main north-south street. However, in the section south of the Sanjo-dori Street, the role has been taken over by the route that was once taken by Kyoto Municipal Streetcars - diverging to the Koin-dori Street and continuing south into the Omiya-dori Street from the Shijo-dori Street.

The section north of Sanjo-dori Street, was widened during the Meiji and Taisho eras, serving as the main north-south street. However, in the section south of Sanjo-dori Street the role has been taken over by the route once held by Kyoto Municipal Streetcars: diverging to Koin-dori Street and continuing south into Omiya-dori Street from Shijo-dori Street.

The section north of Sanjo-dori Street was widened during the Meiji and Taisho periods and served as the main north-south street; however, in the section south of Sanjo-dori Street the role has been taken over by the route once held by Kyoto City Trams, diverging to Koin-dori Street and continuing into Omiya-dori Street south from Shijo-dori Street.

sen.j: 三条通以南の千本通そのものは古くからの道幅を残す。
sen.e: The street north from the Sanjo-dori has long been as wide as what it was in early days.
The street north from the Sanjo-dori has long been as wide as what it was in early days.
The street south of Sanjo-dori Street has long been as wide as what it was in the early days.

sen.j: 歴史、由来
sen.e: History, Origin
History, Origin
History, Origin

sen.j: 平安京の中心朱雀大路をその起源とする。
sen.e: The street was originally the Suzakuoji broad avenue, the central avenue of Heiankyo.
The street was originally Suzakuoji Broad Avenue, the central avenue of Heiankyo.
The street was originally the broad avenue called Suzakuojie, the central avenue of Heian-kyo.

sen.j: この朱雀大路は船岡山が正面に来るように決められたとも言われる。
sen.e: The street was said to have been laid out in such a manner as the Mt. Funaoka is straight ahead.
The street was said to have been laid out in such a manner that Mt. Funaoka was directly ahead.
The street was said to have been laid out in such a manner that Mt. Funaoka was directly ahead.

sen.j: 一説には、船岡山西麓の葬送地への道に千本の仏塔を建て供養したのが通り名の由来とする。
sen.e: Some say that its name comes from Buddhist pagoda that was placed to say a mass to the dead carried to the burial site at the west foot of Mt. Funaoka.
sen.cmt: 仏塔[英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: Some say its name comes from Buddhist pagoda that was placed in order to say a mass to the dead carried to the burial site at the western foot of Mt. Funaoka.
Some say its name comes from the thousand Buddhist pagodas that were placed in order to hold a mass for the dead carried to the burial site at the western foot of Mt. Funaoka.

sen.j: 右京の衰退によって、都の西のはずれの道になり、大内裏の消失によって二条通以北の本来、大内裏のあるべきところにも延長された。
sen.e: With a decline of Ukyo (west part of the capital), it became a street on west outskirt of the capital. In addition, Dai-dairi (place of the Imperial Palace and government offices) was forced to moved and the street was extended from the Nijo-dori street through the area where Dai-dairi should have been located.

With the decline of Ukyo (the western part of the capital), it became a street on west outskirt of the capital. Additionally, the Dai-dairi (site of the Imperial Palace and government offices) had to be moved and the street was extended from Nijo-dori Street through the area where the Dai-dairi should have been located.

With the decline of Ukyo (the western part of the capital), it became a street on the western outskirt of the capital. Additionally, the Dai-dairi (site of the Imperial Palace and government offices) had to be moved, and the street was extended to the north from Nijo-dori Street through the area where the Dai-dairi should have been located.

sen.j: 現在では京都の中央の南北の通りの地位を烏丸通に譲っている。
sen.e: Today it has conceded the position of the central north-south avenue to the Karasuma-dori Street.
Today it has conceded its position as the central north-south avenue to Karasuma-dori Street.
Today it has conceded its position as the central north-south avenue to Karasuma-dori Street.

sen.j: 明治末の京都市の三大事業の一つとして拡幅と市電の敷設が行われ、北大路通から三条は京都市電千本線が通っていた。
sen.e: In the late Meiji era, as a part of three major reconstruction project of Kyoto City, the rails of Municipal Streetcars were laid on widened streets, and the Sembon Line of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar ran on the street between the Kitaoji-dori Street and Sanjo.

During the late Meiji era, as part of three major reconstruction projects in Kyoto City, the rails of municipal streetcars were laid on widened streets, and the Sembon Line of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar ran on the street between Kitaoji-dori Street and Sanjo.

During the late Meiji period, as part of three major reconstruction projects in Kyoto City, the widening of streets and the construction of the City Trams were carried out, and the Senbon Line of Kyoto City Trams ran on the street between Kitaoji-dori Street and Sanjo.
sen.cmt: Senbonとしました。訳を追加しました。

sen.j: 明治、大正の頃には三条から今出川通の北にかけて河原町通と並ぶ繁華街として栄えた。
sen.e: In the Meiji and Taisho eras, the street between Sanjo and the Imadegawa-dori Street was a shopping and entertainment area that compared to the Kawaramachi-dori Street.
During the Meiji and Taisho eras, the street between Sanjo and Imadegawa-dori Street was a shopping-and-entertainment area that compared to Kawaramachi-dori Street.
During the Meiji and Taisho periods, the street between Sanjo and Imadegawa-dori Street was an area for shopping and entertainment that compared to Kawaramachi-dori Street.

sen.j: ここでは、主要な通りとしての三条通以北について記述する。
sen.e: Here describes are crossing roads north of the Sanjo-dori Street with the section as the main avenue
Described herein are the crossing roads north of Sanjo-dori Street with the section as the main avenue.

sen.j: 上側が北側、下側が南側。
sen.e: North is upper and south is lower.
North is upper, and south is lower.
North is upper, and south is lower.

sen.j: 左側が西側、右側が東側。
sen.e: West is north and East is right.
